Text: Issue with San Juan Historic VolatilityKim I wanted to forward you this email that I sent to Vince He had come back to Richard and I to resolve an issue with the dropping VaR associated with TW Vince was asking if this was related to the processes that we have automated In speaking with Vernon the date of the ERMS problem with the San Juan basis discussed below happened to coincide with the date or near proximity of the unwinding the Wholesale positions that TW had held Consequently there were substantial changes with the VaR increasing during this period When the rolling price data dropped off it rolls for days the VaR decreased substantially If you have any questions please give me a call Sean Forwarded by Sean BolksHOUDynegy on PM To From Sean BolksHOUDynegy Date PM cc Richard RiehmHOUDynegy Subject Issue with San Juan Historic Volatility Vince I left you a message concerning the issue with the VaR The problem is associated with the ERMS Price that came on December The basis was instead of This is represented in SJ Price Quote File below Consequently the inclusion of this date in the rolling day bucket for the Historical Volatility calculation essentially changed the volatility for the entire Winter strip Any II deal involving the San Juan was thus flawed and shown in the VaR As this did occur on December th this should have been caught in the December time period for any VaR report done on a daily basis since that time For example the San Juan Historical Volatility was on December on December on December and on December The VaR went up in the same way it came down on Feb it was on Feb it was on Feb it was and on Feb it was This is shown in the attached file San Juan Hist Vol As Richard and I do the base calculations which are correct we would never catch this mistake We are somewhat surprised that when this volatility was included on December th the VaR report did not show a substantial increase from the previous day In the same way the VaR dropped by half we would have expected it to double over a period of a couple of days in that week of December All in all this issue took hours for Richard and I to resolve As it is essentially out of the perview of setting up the SAS automation processthe process did run correctly it was a little frustrating for us to devote the time to identifying this particular issue It would also appear to be a troubling issue from a financial perspective given the current Enron environment I hope this resolves the problem Sean
